tidbits.title: River Delta
tidbits.description: Bangladesh is home to the world's largest river delta, formed by the Ganges, Brahmaputra, and Meghna rivers, shaping a unique and fertile landscape.

tidbits.title: Microcredit Movement
tidbits.description: Bangladesh is known for pioneering microcredit initiatives like Grameen Bank, empowering impoverished communities by providing small loans, primarily to women.

tidbits.title: Mangrove Forests
tidbits.description: The Sundarbans, shared with India, is the largest mangrove forest globally, hosting diverse wildlife, including the Bengal tiger, and serving as a natural barrier against storms.
